com.concordium.sdk.responses.blockitemsummary

Enum UpdateType

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<UpdateType>
      • com.concordium.sdk.responses.blockitemsummary.UpdateType
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<UpdateType>

    public enum UpdateType
extends Enum<UpdateType>
    The chain updates that are possible on the chain. See ChainParametersV0 and ChainParametersV1

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      ADD_ANONYMITY_REVOKER
      An anonymity revoker was registered on the chain.
      ADD_IDENTITY_PROVIDER
      An identity provider was registered on the chain.
      BAKER_STAKE_THRESHOLD_UPDATE

      Update to the FinalizationCommitteeParameters This determines how bakers are being selected for being member of the finalization committee.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • UPDATE_PROTOCOL

        public static final UpdateType UPDATE_PROTOCOL
        A protocol update. These types of updates alter the protocol used on the chain. See ProtocolVersion

      • UPDATE_ELECTION_DIFFICULTY

        public static final UpdateType UPDATE_ELECTION_DIFFICULTY
        The election difficulty determines the lottery power of bakers on the chain and hence which baker wins in a certain slot. This is only used in protocol versions 1-5.

      • UPDATE_EURO_PER_ENERGY

        public static final UpdateType UPDATE_EURO_PER_ENERGY
        An update that alters the euro per energy chain parameter. This is used to peg the execution cost of transactions to the euro.

      • UPDATE_MICRO_CCD_PER_EURO

        public static final UpdateType UPDATE_MICRO_CCD_PER_EURO
        An update that alters the micro CCD per euro parameter. This is used to peg the execution cost of transactions to the euro.

      • UPDATE_FOUNDATION_ACCOUNT

        public static final UpdateType UPDATE_FOUNDATION_ACCOUNT
        An update that updates the registered foundation account on the chain. A chain is initialized with a foundation account which receives a percentage of minted CCD. This is to ensure that the concordium blockchain has sufficient resources to maintain the chain and its ecosystem.

      • UPDATE_MINT_DISTRIBUTION

        public static final UpdateType UPDATE_MINT_DISTRIBUTION
        An update that alters the actual mint distribution on the chain. Only applicable in protocol versions 1-5.

      • UPDATE_TRANSACTION_FEE_DISTRIBUTION

        public static final UpdateType UPDATE_TRANSACTION_FEE_DISTRIBUTION
        An update that alters the transaction fee distribution parameters on the chain. This determines the transaction fees paid among the baker, the GAS account and the foundation account.

      • UPDATE_GAS_REWARDS

        public static final UpdateType UPDATE_GAS_REWARDS
        An update that alters the GAS rewards. The GAS rewards determines how much the GAS account pays out to the baker (pool). Note that from protocol version 6 and onwards bakers are no longer rewarded for including finalization proofs in a block. This is since the consensus protocol changed from protocol version 6 and finalization happens due to a different mechanic than previous.

      • BAKER_STAKE_THRESHOLD_UPDATE

        public static final UpdateType BAKER_STAKE_THRESHOLD_UPDATE
        An update that alters what the required stake is in order to be eligible for baking.

      • UPDATE_POOL_PARAMETERS

        public static final UpdateType UPDATE_POOL_PARAMETERS
        An update that alters the pool parameters. From protocol version 1-3 the parameters consisted solely of the threshold required for being eligible to bake. The parameters changed in protocol version 4 in order to support baker pools and thus there are various parameters determining how baker pools can behave.

      • ADD_ANONYMITY_REVOKER

        public static final UpdateType ADD_ANONYMITY_REVOKER
        An anonymity revoker was registered on the chain.

      • ADD_IDENTITY_PROVIDER

        public static final UpdateType ADD_IDENTITY_PROVIDER
        An identity provider was registered on the chain.

      • UPDATE_ROOT_KEYS

        public static final UpdateType UPDATE_ROOT_KEYS
        Root keys were updated.

      • UPDATE_LEVEL1_KEYS

        public static final UpdateType UPDATE_LEVEL1_KEYS
        Level 1 keys were updated.

      • UPDATE_LEVEL2_KEYS

        public static final UpdateType UPDATE_LEVEL2_KEYS
        Level 2 keys were updated. The level 2 keys can issue chain parameter updates (if a sufficient number of signatures are collected)

      • UPDATE_COOLDOWN_PARAMETERS

        public static final UpdateType UPDATE_COOLDOWN_PARAMETERS
        Update to the cooldown parameters. Cooldown parameters determines the cooldown associated with de-registering a baker or lowering their stake. From protcol version 4 this also determines the cooldown for delegators lowering their delegated stake.

      • UPDATE_TIME_PARAMETERS

        public static final UpdateType UPDATE_TIME_PARAMETERS
        Update to the time parameters. Introduced as part of protocol version 4 these parameters determines the duration of the reward period i.e. the time between paydays. Paydays are special events that occur in blocks which pays out the accumulated rewards during the reward period.

      • UPDATE_TIMEOUT_PARAMETERS

        public static final UpdateType UPDATE_TIMEOUT_PARAMETERS
        Update the timeout parameters. This update is possible from protocol version 6 and onwards. These parameters determine how the duration of a round grows and shrinks due to timeouts.

      • UPDATE_MIN_BLOCK_TIME

        public static final UpdateType UPDATE_MIN_BLOCK_TIME
        Update to the minimum block time parameter. Only applicable from protocol version 6 and onwards. This determines the minimum duration between blocks.

      • UPDATE_BLOCK_ENERGY_LIMIT

        public static final UpdateType UPDATE_BLOCK_ENERGY_LIMIT
        Update to the maximum energy that can be spent in a block. Only applicable from protocol version 6 and onwards.

      • UPDATE_FINALIZATION_COMMITTEE_PARAMETERS

        public static final UpdateType UPDATE_FINALIZATION_COMMITTEE_PARAMETERS
        Update to the FinalizationCommitteeParameters This determines how bakers are being selected for being member of the finalization committee. This parameter is only applicable from protocol version 6 and onwards.

    • Method Detail

      • values

        public static UpdateType[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (UpdateType c : UpdateType.values())
    System.out.println(c);
        Returns:
        an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared

      • valueOf

        public static UpdateType valueOf(String name)
        Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the enum constant to be returned.
        Returns:
        the enum constant with the specified name
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if this enum type has no constant with the specified name
        NullPointerException - if the argument is null
